alert.note: Alert for Augusta; City of Staunton; City of Waynesboro (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 06 at 9:39PM EDT until May 07 at 12:45AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Augusta County in western Virginia... The City of Staunton in western Virginia... The City of Waynesboro in western Virginia... * Until 1245 AM EDT. * At 939 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Staunton... Waynesboro... Stuarts Draft... Sherando... Fishersville... Verona... Lyndhurst... Greenville... Middlebrook... Mint Spring... Swoope... Trimbles Mill... Hermitage... Summerdean... This includes the following Flood Prone Roads: Patton Farm Road at South River... Route 250 at Desper Hollow Road... New Hope Road at Lewis Creek... Kirby Avenue... 10th St and Jackson Avenue in Waynesboro... A Street at Steele Run... FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Augusta; City of Staunton; City of Waynesboro
